model_sqlite module¶

A Model part of the Bookmark manager, implemented with SQLLite database. Database connection is kept open during the application works as SQLite is a local db. SQLite row_factor by default is None, return a tuple.

class model_sqlite.ModelSQLite¶

Bases: object

Class of the Model part for Bookmarks manager. A SQLite implementation.

add_node(attr_dict: dict, node_type: bool)¶

Add a folder or url to the SQLite tree. DB connection and cursor have established by db create or open methods. Common dict fields (in the ‘tree’ table order) -

guid - to fill if empty or omitted, primary key parent_guid - to find from parent_name field and fill, id_no - set 0 if it’s omitted otherwise copy, name - no changes, simply copy, date_added - to fill if empty or omitted

node_type BOOL - from node_type param,

Folder dict fields (in the ‘folder’ table order) -

node_id - fill from ‘guid’ of ‘tree’ table, primary and foreign key date_modified to fill if empty or omitted

Url dict fields (in the ‘url’ table order) -

node_id - fill from ‘guid’ of ‘tree’ table, primary and foreign key url - set empty if it is omitted otherwise copy icon - set empty if it is omitted otherwise copy keywords - set empty if it is omitted otherwise copy

Parameters:

  • attr_dict – dictionary with initial node attributes

  • node_type – True for folder adding, False for url

Returns:

nothing

convert_chrome(filename: str) → tuple[bool, str]¶

Convert Chrome bookmark JSON filename to the current tree. Return (True/False, error message)

Parameters:

filename – Google bookmark filename to convert

Returns:

(True, empty string) or (False, error message)

convert_mozilla(filename: str) → tuple[bool, str]¶

Convert Mozilla bookmark filename to the current tree. Return (True/False, error message).

Parameters:

filename – Mozilla bookmark filename to convert

Returns:

(True, empty string) or (False, error message)

create_database(name: str)¶

Create a database file and empty SQL bookmark structure. Add ‘roots’ node of the tree. Close existing db connection if someone is opened.

Exceptions:

FileExistsError if given filename exists

Parameters:

name – name of the new database, filename for it

Returns:

nothing

delete_database(name)¶

Delete the database file. Close connection and reset db_name, connection flag before.

Exception:

FileNotFoundError if the filename does not exist

Parameters:

name – name and filename of the deleting database

Returns:

nothing

delete_node(name: str)¶

Delete a node from the sqlite db. Delete the row from ‘tree’ table. Delete the child row automatically with ON DELETE CASCADE option

Raises:

  • NodeNotExists – if node_name does not exist

  • FolderNotEmpty – if node_name folder is not empty

Parameters:

name – node name to delete

Returns:

nothing

get_children(node_name: str) → tuple[bool, tuple[str, ...]]¶

Get a list of child names of the node.

Exceptions:

NodeNotExists if node_name does not exist

Parameters:

node_name – name of a node

Returns:

True/False, tuple of child’s names/empty tuple

get_node(name: str) → dict[str, Any]¶

Get a node content as a dict. For folder node return a list of children names as ‘children’: [str, …] key, value pair Does not duplicate primary keys ‘node_id’ of ‘folder’ and ‘url’ child tables Delete node_type column from resulting dictionary

Exceptions:

raise NodeNotExists if node name does not exist

Parameters:

name – node name

Returns:

dictionary {field_name: field_value} of the node

open_database(name: str)¶

Open an existing SQLite database. Close existing db connection if someone is opened.

Exception:

FileNotFoundError if the filename does not exist

Parameters:

name – name and filename of the opening database

Returns:

nothing

update_node(name: str, attr_dict: dict)¶

Update a folder or url of the SQLite database. User can update:

name - for folder and url nodes url, icon, keywords - for url nodes date_modified - will be updated automatically for the parent folder of the updating node

Parameters:

  • name – updating node name

  • attr_dict – dictionary with the updating fields

Returns:

nothing
